title: Learning Tech Words: Programming, Code, and Tools
description: This AI-generated unit helps beginner English learners practice listening and writing skills using common terms from the world of programming and software development.

exercises.text: I want to start learning programming.
exercises.hint: The first word is 'I'. 'Programming' is a long word that means creating software.

exercises.text: Can you write some Python code?
exercises.hint: 'Python' starts with a capital P and is a popular programming language. 'Code' is the set of instructions for a computer.

exercises.text: Many people use VSCode to write code.
exercises.hint: VSCode is often written as one word. It's a popular editor for writing 'code'.

exercises.text: A: What is Flutter? B: It is a tool for building apps.
exercises.hint: 'Flutter' starts with F-L-U-T-T-E-R. It is a framework for creating mobile applications.

exercises.text: I use Python in VSCode for my programming projects with Flutter.
exercises.hint: This sentence combines several keywords: Python, VSCode, programming, and Flutter. Listen carefully to the sequence.
